title: normal bone marrow-derived exosomes #1
growth_protocol_ch1: Exosomes were purified from cell culture supernatant of BM-MSCs. FBS used in culture media for exosome isolation was pre-cleared by ultracentrifugation at 100,000× g for 3 hr at 4°C. Supernatant fractions collected from 48 hours BM-MSC cultures were filtered using a filtration on 0.22 m pore filters, as previously described (Valadi et al., 2007; Ostrowski et al., 2010), followed by ultracentrifugation at 20,000g for 20 min, and incubation with an exosome precipitation solution (ExoQuick, System Biosciences, Mountain View, CA) (Karolina et al., 2011). Exosomes were then harvested by ultracentrifugation at 100,000g for 70 min, as previously described (Pelinado et al., 2012).
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated using RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA), according to manufacturer’s protocol and as previously described (Valadi Nature Cell Biol, 2007).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA is converted into cDNA using a single "megaplex" reverse transcriptase reaction. The megaplex reaction contains a specific stem-loop primer for each of the mature target microRNA's (Each stem-loop primer is designed to hybridize to only the fully mature microRNA, and not to precursor forms of its target.). The cDNA is subjected to a "pre-amplification" PCR.   Sixty nanograms of RNA is used in the reverse transcription reaction. A stem-loop primer for each target miRNA is present in the reaction. The 3' region of each primer is complementary to the 3' region of its target miRNA. The 5' region of the primer is a non-miRNA "tail" and contains a sequence that will serve as the reverse primer in the pre-amplification and RT-PCR reactions.   A portion of the cDNA reaction is added to a "pre-amplification" PCR reaction. The primers in the pre-amplification reaction consist of  (1) a mixture of forward primers, each of which anneals to a specific miRNA cDNA, and (2) a single reverse primer sequence that anneals to the complement of the stem/loop primer "tail", a sequence that is present in every miRNA cDNA.   The pre-amplification reaction is diluted, and a portion of it is added to a solution containing Taq polymerase and deoxynucleotide triphosphates. This solution is distributed to the wells of a 384-well plate via microfluidic channels in the card rather than by pipetting into individual wells. The 384-well plates are called TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA) cards. Each well contains a specific miRNA forward primer, a specific miRNA TaqMan® probe, and a reverse "tail" primer.  Thermocycling and data collection are carried out on an Applied Biosystems 7900HT instrument.
data_processing: Mean miRNA expression value has been used for miRNA RT-qPCR data normalization, as described (Mestdagh et al., 2009).
data_processing.1: Comparison between normal (n=4), and MM- (n=7), MGUS (n=2) BM-MSCs-derived exosomes  was performed by using dChip software (1.5 fold change; P <0.05).
data_processing.2: ΔΔCt: one normal control (sample #3) has been used for the calcualtion of the ΔΔCt values

A portion of the cDNA reaction is added to a "pre-amplification" PCR reaction. The primers in the pre-amplification reaction consist of  (1) a mixture of forward primers, each of which anneals to a specific miRNA cDNA, and (2) a single reverse primer sequence that anneals to the complement of the stem/loop primer "tail", a sequence that is present in every miRNA cDNA.   The pre-amplification reaction is diluted, and a portion of it is added to a solution containing Taq polymerase and deoxynucleotide triphosphates. This solution is distributed to the wells of a 384-well plate via microfluidic channels in the card rather than by pipetting into individual wells. The 384-well plates are called TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA) cards. Each well contains a specific miRNA forward primer, a specific miRNA TaqMan® probe, and a reverse "tail" primer.  Thermocycling and data collection are carried out on an Applied Biosystems 7900HT instrument.
data_processing: Mean miRNA expression value has been used for miRNA RT-qPCR data normalization, as described (Mestdagh et al., 2009).
data_processing.1: Comparison between normal (n=4), and MM- (n=7), MGUS (n=2) BM-MSCs-derived exosomes  was performed by using dChip software (1.5 fold change; P <0.05).
data_processing.2: ΔΔCt: one normal control (sample #3) has been used for the calcualtion of the ΔΔCt values

title: multiple myeloma bone marrow-derived exosomes #4
growth_protocol_ch1: Exosomes were purified from cell culture supernatant of BM-MSCs. FBS used in culture media for exosome isolation was pre-cleared by ultracentrifugation at 100,000× g for 3 hr at 4°C. Supernatant fractions collected from 48 hours BM-MSC cultures were filtered using a filtration on 0.22 m pore filters, as previously described (Valadi et al., 2007; Ostrowski et al., 2010), followed by ultracentrifugation at 20,000g for 20 min, and incubation with an exosome precipitation solution (ExoQuick, System Biosciences, Mountain View, CA) (Karolina et al., 2011). Exosomes were then harvested by ultracentrifugation at 100,000g for 70 min, as previously described (Pelinado et al., 2012).
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated using RNeasy mini kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA), according to manufacturer’s protocol and as previously described (Valadi Nature Cell Biol, 2007).
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA is converted into cDNA using a single "megaplex" reverse transcriptase reaction. The megaplex reaction contains a specific stem-loop primer for each of the mature target microRNA's (Each stem-loop primer is designed to hybridize to only the fully mature microRNA, and not to precursor forms of its target.). The cDNA is subjected to a "pre-amplification" PCR.   Sixty nanograms of RNA is used in the reverse transcription reaction. A stem-loop primer for each target miRNA is present in the reaction. The 3' region of each primer is complementary to the 3' region of its target miRNA. The 5' region of the primer is a non-miRNA "tail" and contains a sequence that will serve as the reverse primer in the pre-amplification and RT-PCR reactions.   A portion of the cDNA reaction is added to a "pre-amplification" PCR reaction. The primers in the pre-amplification reaction consist of  (1) a mixture of forward primers, each of which anneals to a specific miRNA cDNA, and (2) a single reverse primer sequence that anneals to the complement of the stem/loop primer "tail", a sequence that is present in every miRNA cDNA.   The pre-amplification reaction is diluted, and a portion of it is added to a solution containing Taq polymerase and deoxynucleotide triphosphates. This solution is distributed to the wells of a 384-well plate via microfluidic channels in the card rather than by pipetting into individual wells. The 384-well plates are called TaqMan Low Density Array (TLDA) cards. Each well contains a specific miRNA forward primer, a specific miRNA TaqMan® probe, and a reverse "tail" primer.  Thermocycling and data collection are carried out on an Applied Biosystems 7900HT instrument.
data_processing: Mean miRNA expression value has been used for miRNA RT-qPCR data normalization, as described (Mestdagh et al., 2009).
data_processing.1: Comparison between normal (n=4), and MM- (n=7), MGUS (n=2) BM-MSCs-derived exosomes  was performed by using dChip software (1.5 fold change; P <0.05).
data_processing.2: ΔΔCt: one normal control (sample #3) has been used for the calcualtion of the ΔΔCt values
